title.narrative: Myanmar Artemisinin Resistant Containment II (MARC II)

description.narrative: 1) Prevent and control malaria by promoting personal protective measures and by introducing environmental measures as a principle method depending on local epidemiological condition and available resources; 2) Provide early diagnosis and appropriate treatment; 3) Promote capacity building of malaria control program (human, financial and technical); 4) Strengthen partnership by means of intra-sectoral and inter-sectoral cooperation and collaboration and with public sectors, private sectors, local and international nongovernmental organizations, and UN agencies; 5) Conduct community health worker training; 6) Intensify community participation, involvement and empowerment.

The MARC II project is the second phase of malaria –related Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) achievement in terms of malaria no longer being a major cause of morbidity, mortality and no longer a barrier to social and economic development and growth anywhere in the Myanmar project sites. The contribution of voluntary health workers, community based organizations and the World Concern staff are essential to this phase and the reduction of the communicable disease burden. MARC II provides locally appropriate vector control measures and personal protection for prevention of malaria and its transmission/spread of Artemisinin resistance to other parts of the country.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
